pkgmetadata.longdescription: Design Shaded Contour Lines (or Tanaka) Maps // The Tanaka method enhances the representation of topography on a map using shaded contour lines. In this simplified implementation of the method, north-west white contours represent illuminated topography and south-east black contours represent shaded topography. See Tanaka (1950) doi:10.2307/211219.
